title: Installation issue: pkgconf

labels.name: download-error
labels.description: The package source cannot be downloaded

body:
### Steps to reproduce the issue

```console
$ spack install pkgconf
==> Installing pkgconf
==> Searching for binary cache of pkgconf
==> Warning: No Spack mirrors are currently configured
==> No binary for pkgconf found: installing from source
==> Fetching http://distfiles.dereferenced.org/pkgconf/pkgconf-1.6.0.tar.xz

curl: (6) Could not resolve host: distfiles.dereferenced.org
==> Fetching from http://distfiles.dereferenced.org/pkgconf/pkgconf-1.6.0.tar.xz failed.
==> Error: FetchError: All fetchers failed for pkgconf-1.6.0-v4yrfswprkxnyfhnagk37yyjkskahyj5

<spack_root_directory>/lib/spack/spack/package.py:965, in do_fetch:
        962                raise FetchError("Will not fetch %s" %
        963                                 self.spec.format('$_$@'), ck_msg)
        964
  >>    965        self.stage.create()
        966        self.stage.fetch(mirror_only)
        967        self._fetch_time = time.time() - start_time
        968
```

I also tried to get download the `tar`-file using `wget`, which also couldn't resolve the host.

### Platform and user environment

Please report your OS here:
```commandline
$ uname -a 
Linux theseus 4.15.0-47-generic #50~16.04.1-Ubuntu SMP Fri Mar 15 16:06:21 UTC 2019 x86_64 x86_64 x86_64 GNU/Linux
$ lsb_release -d
Description:	Ubuntu 16.04.6 LTS
``` 
and, if relevant, post or attach:

- `packages.yaml`: default settings
- `compilers.yaml`:
   `spack compilers` lists
    ```
    ==> Available compilers
    -- gcc ubuntu16.04-x86_64 ---------------------------------------
    gcc@5.4.0
    ```

### Additional information

Sometimes the issue benefits from additional details. In these cases there are
a few things we can suggest doing. First of all, you can post the full output of:
```console
$ spack spec --install-status <spec>
Input spec
--------------------------------
 -   pkgconf

Concretized
--------------------------------
 -   pkgconf@1.6.0%gcc@5.4.0 arch=linux-ubuntu16.04-x86_64 
```
to show people whether Spack installed a faulty software or if it was not able to
build it at all. 


### Related issues
There are two other issues (#6932, #8037)on the installation of `pkgconf`. I checked them. Based on their description, they are not related to this one.
